thread.author: devin-ai-integration
thread.body:
üü° **ASCII table column widths computed from full titles but rendered with truncated titles** In `cmdPulse`, the column `widths` are calculated from `rows` (which contain full-length titles), but the actual table rows are rendered using `displayRows` (which have titles truncated to 30 chars). This causes the Title column to be excessively wide with unnecessary padding.
Root Cause At line 232, widths are computed from `rows`: ```js const widths = cols.map(c => Math.max(c.length, ...rows.map(r => String(r[c]).length))); ``` But at line 240, the actual cell values come from `displayRows`: ```js console.log(cols.map((c, j) => String(displayRows[i][c]).padEnd(widths[j])).join(' ')); ``` If a title is 80 characters long, the Title column width will be 80, but the displayed value will only be 30 characters, leaving 50 characters of whitespace padding. The header and separator will also be 80 characters wide for that column. **Impact:** The ASCII table output is visually broken with excessive whitespace in the Title column whenever any title exceeds 30 characters.
```suggestion const widths = cols.map(c => Math.max(c.length, ...displayRows.map(r => String(r[c]).length))); ``` --- *Was this helpful? React with üëç or üëé to provide feedback.*
